ammendingline.em: 1 Section 9 of the Transport of Dangerous Goods Act is amended by renumbering subsection (5) as subsection (9) and adding the following subsections:

subsection.subsectiontext: A certificate signed by the minister and showing an amount of money expended by the government under subsection (2) (a), (b) or (c) is conclusive as to the amount expended.

An amount shown by a certificate referred to in subsection (5) is a debt due to the government and is recoverable, subject to subsection (7), by action in the Supreme Court, from the person whose act or neglect caused or who authorized the events that caused the situation described in subsection (1) (a), (b) or (c) in proportions the court determines.
If the court is satisfied that the expenditure incurred by the government under this section was either

paragraph.paragraphtext: excessive, taking into consideration the magnitude of the situation described by subsection (1) (a), (b) or (c) and the results achieved by the expenditure, or
unnecessary, taking into consideration the unlikelihood of significant material loss to any person had the government not acted under this section,

content.subsandwich: the court may reduce or extinguish the amount of the judgment that it otherwise would have ordered be entered against the person against whom the action under subsection (6) has been brought.

subsection.subsectiontext: For the purpose of subsection (6), anything done or omitted by a person acting in the course of the person's employment is also the act or omission of the employer.

section.sectiontext: Section 1 comes into force by regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in Council.
